about_the_game:
"The Last Nordic Tribe" is a survival game set in the brutal realities of the early Middle Ages. The action takes place during the third year of an exceptionally harsh three-year winter, known as the "Little Ragnarök," spanning the years 536-539 AD. This tragic period claimed the lives of 95% of Scandinavia's population, and the memories of these events were preserved centuries later on the Rök Runestone – a warning to future generations.

The game's story has been crafted from scratch, drawing on the limited historical information available. Fictional elements have been added, such as threads of a foreign culture from a fallen empire, the theme of slavery, and the unequal struggle against overwhelming odds – frost and hunger.

Your mission is to survive at all costs, utilizing survival elements like gathering resources and crafting weapons from available components. Encounters with enemies will provide not only valuable experience but also essential materials for survival.

The game faithfully recreates the atmosphere of the time – land covered in volcanic ash, barren trees, wooden buildings, and the characteristic aesthetics and culture of the early Middle Ages. All of this combines to create a dark and immersive experience that transports players to the icy, unforgiving world of the "Little Ragnarök."

Can you survive in a world where history was never meant to be so brutal?

content_descriptors.notes: Adult content is an integral part of the game's storyline and stems from the game's specifics. They relate to the survivalist realities, the historical context of the early Middle Ages and the harshness of the living conditions depicted in the game. They are not extreme, but their presence is essential to the authenticity of the story.

short_description: "The Last Nordic Tribe" is a survival game set during the "Little Ragnarök" (536-539 AD), where 95% of Scandinavia's population perished. Survive the harsh winter, battle hunger, foes, and adversity, exploring a brutal world inspired by the early Middle Ages. Will you rise to the challenge?
